headline: As Ohio welcomes Intel, DeWine-Husted gains talking point for reelection bid
author: Jessie Balmert
sentences:
Intel comes to Ohio: Economy always the biggest issue to voters
By building computer chips in Ohio rather than abroad, DeWine's campaign can also focus on retaking economic opportunities from China, a country that Republicans hold an increasingly negative view of.

Former Dayton Mayor Nan Whaley critiqued the state's economic focus on central Ohio, saying "this is great news for New Albany and the Columbus area, but we need a real commitment to bring good jobs to communities all over Ohio, not just the Columbus region."

"Intel's announcement today is a signal to China and to the rest of the world that from now on, our essential manufactured products in this country will be made in the United States of America," DeWine said.

Jessie Balmert is a reporter for the USA TODAY Network Ohio Bureau, which serves the Akron Beacon Journal, Cincinnati Enquirer, Columbus Dispatch and 18 other affiliated news organizations across Ohio.
